paraBlock.para:
In July 2020, the AICPA issued , , which supersedes AU-C section 500, , and amends the following AU-C sections:SAS No. 142 explains what constitutes audit evidence in an audit of financial statements and sets out attributes of information that are taken into account by the auditor when evaluating information to be used as audit evidence. Statement on Auditing Standards (SAS) No. 142 Audit Evidence Audit Evidence
, Section 200 Overall Objectives of the Independent Auditor and the Conduct of an Audit in Accordance With Generally Accepted Auditing Standards
, Section 230 Audit Documentation
, Section 315 Understanding the Entity and Its Environment and Assessing the Risks of Material Misstatement
, Section 330 Performing Audit Procedures in Response to Assessed Risks and Evaluating the Audit Evidence
, Section 501 Audit Evidence — Specific Considerations for Selected Items
, Section 530 Audit Sampling
, Section 540 Auditing Accounting Estimates, Including Fair Value Accounting Estimates, and Related Disclosures

This SAS is effective for audits of financial statements for periods ending on or after December 15, 2022. A link to the final SAS and other resources can be found on the page “,” which is available using the audit and attest link in the financial reporting center at aicpa.org. Recently Issued Auditing and Attestation Standards: Information and Resources

para.emphasis: Update 9-2 : Auditing Accounting Estimates, Including Fair Value Accounting Estimates, and Related Disclosures Auditing

paraBlock.para:
In July 2020, the AICPA issued , , which supersedes , , and amends the following AU-C sections: SAS No. 143 addresses the auditor’s responsibilities relating to accounting estimates, including fair value accounting estimates and related disclosures, in an audit of financial statements. SAS No. 143 AU-C section 540 Auditing Accounting Estimates and Related Disclosures Auditing Accounting Estimates, Including Fair Value Accounting Estimates, and Related Disclosures
, Section 200 Overall Objectives of the Independent Auditor and the Conduct of an Audit in Accordance With Generally Accepted Auditing Standards
, Section 230 Audit Documentation
, Section 240 Consideration of Fraud in a Financial Statement Audit
, Section 260 The Auditor’s Communication With Those Charged With Governance
, Section 501 Audit Evidence — Specific Considerations for Selected Items
, Section 580 Written Representations
, Section 700 Forming an Opinion and Reporting on Financial Statements
, Section 701 Communicating Key Audit Matters in the Independent Auditor’s Report

This SAS is effective for audits of financial statements for periods ending on or after December 15, 2023. A link to the final SAS and other resources can be found on the page “,” which is available using the audit and attest link in the financial reporting center at aicpa.org. Recently Issued Auditing and Attestation Standards: Information and Resources

section.para: Although Martin has invested in financial instruments in the past, it has not invested in a security with a feature that constitutes an embedded derivative. However, Martin’s board of directors exercises proper oversight and authorization of all investing activities. In regard to the convertible bond investment, the board took an active role in understanding the risks of the investment and how it was priced and, ultimately, approving the transaction.
Martin also has other characteristics of a strong control environment:
The bonds are held and serviced by a well-known bank with an investment department that is widely respected.

listitem.para: Management has high integrity and ethical values.
Management philosophy and operating style are commensurate with the demands and needs of a well-regarded business organization.
Management carefully assigns authority and responsibility to appropriate personnel.
Human resource policies and procedures are designed in a way that the most qualified individuals are attracted to the organization, hired, trained, rewarded, and retained.
